intro: Thrixspermum divitiflorum, commonly known as the golden star bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, yellow inflorescences. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
